Everything looks good, and I do get the 404 status when requesting a third that doesn't exist, but not the message?
Here's what I get if I do a GET on http://localhost:2100/third/DoesntExist using PostMan:
{
    "timestamp": "2020-02-11T16:07:52.565+0000",
    "status": 404,
    "error": "Not Found",
    "message": "Not Found",
    "path": "/third/DoesntExist"
}

I can't figure out what that is... If I try another similar method and do a GET on : http://localhost:2103/users/doesntexist/settings
I do get the correct message:
{
    "status": "NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "User setting for user doesntexist not found"
}

I've compared the two but can't find the difference ?

Good find and interesting!
If I issue a curl it seems to work though:
curl -v "http://localhost:2100/thirds/DoesNotExist" -H  "accept: application/json" -H "Authorization:Bearer $token"
I get the following response (removed uninterested parts):
 < HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
<...>
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact {"status":"NOT_FOUND","message":"Third with name DoesNotExist was not found"}
I think you made a mistake in the URL by omitting the last s in http://localhost:2100/thirds
Hi Jeroen, you're completely right, my mistake! Sorry!
